page.title: 17OUR SCHOOL HISTORY
page.content: In his will of 1729, Matthew Caldbeck bequeathed Â£100 for the education of the poorer children of the parish, but it was not until 1749 that the interest from the bequest was used to found a Grammar School in the village. In 1880 Parkin Croft was bought from John Bouch Esq. for the building of the present school to educate 175 children. Money was raised by public subscription and the school was completed at acost of Â£1095. The school is built in sandstone with a slate roof in the late Victorian style. The original building had three classrooms with two porches and outside toilets. A canteen was built in 1951, major internal improvements were carried out in the 1960s and in 1976 the new toilet block and cloakroom was built on.
